column4: ï»¿Ubuntu Hardy | Linux SGC-Atlantis 2.6.24-17-generic | FritzBoxWLAN Stick | Does not work. PLEASE HELP OUT!
that kernel is not supported
what is the chipset of that
if pci then lspci; if usb then lsusb
that is the brand name-->we need a chipset like broadcom or the like
that site says you have to either: 1)compile the source yourself and insert the module, or 2) use ndiswrapper to do it-->no listing for Hardy though
this is an external usb dongle correct?
not sure how to get that working with either Hardy regular or your special kernel--> it works well with Gutsy though
how about putting sources.list on paste.ubuntu.com
http://paste.ubuntu.com/27262/
now I get this error: http://paste.ubuntu.com/27264/
what did you add to your sources.list? there are two sets (nearly) in there
I replaced mine with yours, deleted all sources.list.save and deleted the contents in /var/lib/apt/lists and /var/lib/apt/lists/partial except the folder partial which is needed
then sudo apt-get update
that is not the correct directory; are you using ubuntu or another distro
I am using Ubuntu Hardy
the correct place is /etc/apt/sources.list
yes I saved the contents of your file into that place
are you using gnome?
gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list and then paste in the new one over the old one

OK I solved the problem. It was really strange and I don't understand what the reason was. I doubleclicked sources.list the assigned applications opened up. I changed the Mainserver to a Server in  Germany and it worked..
nice.
yes Security is ticked now..
